Hey Zane! How do you have the motivation to make animations, I tried to be a full-time animator but procrastination came in and spanked me really hard, I'm starting to get the motivation back but it's still kinda hard to just get up and get some freakin' animation done. Do you have any possible feedback for this my good sir?
questions.answer: Write down your daily goals, don't doomscroll or play video games until you've completed them, and when things are tough, just force yourself to animate for 10 minutes. You'll probably end up working for longer than that

questions.answer: The world's longest sub sandwich was 2,411 feet (735 meters) long and approximately 1,300 pounds (577.03 kilograms) in weight. It contained chicken, mayonnaise, lettuce, tomato, pickles, red vinegar, salt, mustard, white pepper, lemon juice, kamouneh spices and coriander. It took 136 cooks, and 639 sandwich-fillers 22 hours to create the sub. It was made in Beirut, Lebanon on May 22 2011.

questions.question: (sigh) less motivation stinks ya know! It is the art blocky that really bullies me for real! Anyways, how do I prevent something from being bullied by an art blocky?
questions.answer: If that something is you, in most cases you have to take the beating and try to keep moving forwards. Things like phone or games will summon the art block. Try to start your day with no distractions and set your sights on your goal first thing. That way the art block can't beat you to your destination.

questions.question: How did Speedrick Faston become so fast?
Did You Make Groovy Specimens?
How fast can Speedrick Faston go?
questions.answer: Supersonic (>768mph) in a vacuum. He would probably lose contact with the ground at about 170mph or so due to lift caused by air drag, but if he had a weight strapped to him, he would probably start eroding at about 500mph due to particles in the air sandblasting his skin. Assuming perfectly clean air, he'd probably make it close to 700mph before succumbing to 3rd degree burns.
